intro: Hosackia trisperma, commonly known as the three-sepal milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seed pods are slender and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Hosackia trisperma plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators.
